Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Modified Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction in Surgical Interns

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised to an 8-week modified Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) program or an active control

Participants.evidence: A pilot randomised controlled trial was conducted at a tertiary academic medical center from April 30, 2016, to December 2017. Twenty-one surgical interns

Intervention.evidence: randomised to an 8-week modified Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) program or an active control

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was feasibility, assessed across six domains

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was at the individual level, with allocation concealment

Number_Analysed.evidence: The intervention demonstrated feasibility and acceptability, evidenced by no attrition

Result_Outcome.evidence: Course satisfaction and perceived credibility were higher in the intervention group (P = .03)
